page.title: 18MOSSES WILDLIFE-HOLKER MOSS
page.content: The{Roudsea Wood}area supports over 500 different species of wildlife. Limestone plants include Lily of the Valley,Guelder Rose and orchids.Trees on the limestone include ash,oak,lime, cherry and yew.The slate supports a contrasting sessile oakwood with birch,rowan and hazel and a field layer of wavy-haired grass,bracken and purple moor-grass. The valley mire is scattered with birch and alder growing amongst reeds and sedge.These include{"carex flavia" which is only found here.Sphagnum moss is widespread. Roe deer are common with red deer present occasionally.Otters,badgers, squirrels,hares,rabbits,stoats and weasels can all be seen.Many small mammals are present including the dormouse in its most northerly location.
